metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3185 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The make_http_soap_request function in ext/soap/php_http.c in PHP before 5.4.44, 5.5.x before 5.5.28, 5.6.x before 5.6.12, and 7.x before 7.0.4 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from process memory or cause a denial of service (type confusion and application crash) via crafted serialized _cookies data, related to the SoapClient::__call method in ext/soap/soap.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0 - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-bz2 - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-cgi - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2

php7.0-common - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2

No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> bug 71610 is for basically same issue as 70081 that got reverted by mistake at some point. This CVE is for the first second part of bug 70081. See CVE-2015-8835 for the first part.

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.4-5ubuntu2').
